alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Franklin; Fulton; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 28 at 1:50PM EDT until March 28 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southern Bedford County in south central Pennsylvania... Southwestern Franklin County in south central Pennsylvania... Southern Fulton County in south central Pennsylvania... Somerset County in south central Pennsylvania... * Until 230 PM EDT. * At 148 PM EDT, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Mercersburg to Bedford to Central City to near Seven Springs, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 70 from mile markers 152 to 170. The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 100 to 136. Interstate 81 from mile markers 0 to 6. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Somerset, Greencastle, Meyersdale, Warfordsburg, Berlin, Clearville, Mercersburg, Friedens, Buffalo Mills, Big Cove Tannery and Acosta. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Serious injuries and deaths may result from people exiting their vehicles during a snow squall. Drivers may not be able to see you or to stop! If stopped on the roadway or involved in an accident, quickly exit your vehicle move as far away from the roadway as possible ONLY when it is safe to do so. Do not stand along or near the roadway, since approaching vehicles may be unable to maintain control.
